Algirhabdus cladophorae is known to be an epiphytic bacterium, meaning it lives on the surface of the Cladophora algae, forming a symbiotic relationship. This association may provide the bacterium with a stable source of nutrients and protection from environmental stressors.

The exact role and function of Algirhabdus cladophorae within the Cladophora-based ecosystem is not yet fully understood, but it is believed to be involved in various ecological processes, such as nutrient cycling and the maintenance of the algal-bacterial community structure.
